content.description: Tall arete problem with a long, committing move at the end.
content.location: On the SW arete of the tall, skinny boulder just North of the Alien Baby zone.

content.description: On a pillar-like boulder: climb the pretty, tall crack. The crux comes early on with a few thin-hands moves, and the difficulty quickly eases, though the commitment increases. Way fun.
content.protection: Pads, spot, don't fall near the top hopefully.
content.location: North side of the pillar-like boulder between the Gendarme (Alien Baby) area and the Free Willy area. Descend with some sketchy downclimbing opposite the crack.

content.description: Sit start climb directly right of the Tall Crack
content.location: On the N face of the tall cracked boulder (Proctor Rock)

content.description: Nopinyon Arete is a mega-classic problem that, until recently, was difficult to climb due to a large dead tree standing up against the boulder. The tree fell down sometime in the past several years, and now the arete is open for business. Bear hug your way up the right side of the arete until you can reach jugs for an easy top out.
content.location: Nopinyon Arete is on the spire-like boulder that is sitting just north of the Alien Baby area(Gendarme Boulder). This tall boulder is stacked with highball problems on all sides. The Nopinyon Arete is the NW Arete, and starts standing with a left hand pocket on the arete and a high right hand edge. There is a large dead tree in the middle of the landing zone. Downclimb on the SE side of the boulder.

content.description: Loads of Fun is a tall and frightening problem with awesome moves on perfect stone. It involves loading up two undercling crimps, with high feet on insecure smears, and deadpointing for a good, outward pulling sidepull. If your feet skate, you're in for a big awkward fall. If you stick it, pull a couple easier moves to the top.
content.location: On the tall boulder just North of the Alien Baby area. Loads of Fun climbs up the middle of the South face between Wordman and the downclimb crack. Look for perfect gray stone and an obvious undercling at about 12 feet.

content.description: Just another crack to climb up (and down)
content.location: To the right of Loads of Fun, on the opposite side as Tall Crack.

content.description: This is a tall, rectangular boulder just north of the Gerdame/Alien Baby Boulder (the giant one, visible immediately off the trail). It contains about 6 established problems.
